question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Malcolm can run a race at a speed of 6 minutes per mile, while Joshua runs at 8 minutes per mile. In a 10-mile race, how many minutes after Malcolm crosses the finish line will Joshua cross the finish line if they start the race together?
inference: Final Answer: \\boxed{20}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Malcolm will take $6 \cdot 10 = 60$ minutes to finish the race, and Joshua will take $8 \cdot 10 = 80$ minutes to finish the race. Thus, Joshua will cross the finish line $80 - 60 = \boxed{20}$ minutes after Malcolm.
